text: Executive Office of Public Safety Newsletter, June 2006
label: HH1

text: The Executive Office of Public Safety (EOPS) is committed to keeping
label: BODY

text: the people of Massachusetts informed about critical homeland security,
label: BODY

text: emergency management, personal safety, and criminal justice issues.
label: BODY

text: The EOPS newsletter is published monthly for the purpose of sharing
label: BODY

text: current information on events, publications, and funding opportunities
label: BODY

text: among public safety professionals.
label: BODY

text: Suicide Bombings Awareness Course

text: July 25 and July 26, 2006 in Quincy, MA
label: HH3

text: The Massachusetts Emergency Management Agency (MEMA), in Partnership
label: BODY

text: with MBTA Transit Police, are presenting a training to provide participants with
label: BODY

text: basic information concerning explosive and incendiary devices that could be used
label: BODY

text: as terrorist weapons. This course is designed for Emergency Responders
label: BODY

text: including: Fire, Police, EMS, Emergency Management Personnel, Public Works,

text: Survey for the Violence Against Women Act STOP Grant Program
label: HH3

text: To help the Executive Office of Public Safety (EOPS) and the Violence Against
label: BODY

text: Women Act (VAWA) Advisory Committee develop their Three Year Strategic
label: BODY

text: Plan for the Massachusetts Violence Against Women Act STOP (Services,
label: BODY

text: Training, Officers, Prosecutors) Grant Program, the EOPS is administering a
label: BODY

text: survey to members of the criminal justice, court, local/state government, and
label: BODY

text: victim advocate/victim services communities. The survey seeks respondents'
label: BODY

text: views on the criminal justice system’s response to crimes of sexual assault,
label: BODY

text: domestic violence, and stalking in Massachusetts, in a number of areas
label: BODY

text: including: the needs of victims of crimes against women, VAWA program
label: BODY

text: purpose areas, and underserved populations. The EOPS is particularly interested
label: BODY

text: in the professional opinions of front-line staff. The survey takes approximately
label: BODY

text: 15-20 minutes to complete.
label: BODY

text: Contact Diane DeAngelis at diane.deangelis@state.ma.us or (617) 725-3362
label: BODY

text: with any questions or comments.
label: BODY

text: Any individual wishing to complete the survey should enter the following link
label: BODY

text: into their web browser:  http://www.surveymonkey.com/s.asp?u=40952223277
label: BODY

text: Notice on Toyobo Class Action Settlement regarding Zylon Bulletproof
label: HH2

text: Vests
label: HH3

text: Please note there is another limited opportunity for anyone with a Second Chance vest to participate in
label: BODY

text: the Toyobo Class Action Settlement. Toyobo is the exclusive manufacturer of Zylon. Anyone (or
label: BODY

text: department) that had purchased a Second Chance Ultima, Ultimax, or Triflex vest may submit a late
label: BODY

text: claim no later than JULY 1, 2006. For the purpose of this class action settlement, it makes no
label: BODY

text: difference if you have already received a warranty replacement vest or any other remedy offered by
label: BODY

text: Second Chance or its agents. Any Second Chance consumer is eligible.
label: BODY

text: To obtain the registration forms, either visit www.zylonvestclassaction.com or call 1-877-567-2754.
label: BODY

text: EOPS Funding Opportunities
label: HH1

text: The College Environmental Alcohol Prevention Planning and
label: HH3

text: Implementation Grant
label: HH3

text: Application Deadline: June 23, 2006
label: HH3

text: The Governor’s Highway Safety Bureau (GHSB), a program of the Executive
label: BODY

text: Office of Public Safety, announces the availability of approximately $200,000
label: BODY

text: in grant funding for Massachusetts colleges and universities with undergraduate
label: BODY

text: enrollment of 5,000 or less. Colleges and universities will develop and implement
label: BODY

text: an environmentally focused plan to prevent alcohol use and abuse. Proposed
label: BODY

text: programs should focus on limiting access to alcohol, expressing community norms, or programming
label: BODY

text: aimed specifically at impaired driving.
label: BODY

text: For more information: http://www.mass.gov/eopsfunding.htm click on Justice and Education
label: BODY

text: Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention Act Formula Grant Program
label: HH3

text: Bidders’ Conference: June 22, 2006 in Worcester, MA
label: HH3

text: Application Deadline: July 20, 2006
label: HH3

text: EOPS is making approximately $885,000 of funding available from the federal Juvenile Justice and
label: BODY

text: Delinquency Prevention Act (JJDPA) Formula Grant Program, subject to the final award to
label: BODY

text: Massachusetts through the U.S. Department of Justice, Office of Justice Programs, Office of Juvenile
label: BODY

text: Justice and Delinquency Prevention. The purpose of this program is to improve the lives of juveniles in
label: BODY

text: the Commonwealth by preventing their involvement with the juvenile justice system and by improving
label: BODY

text: the operation and services provided by the juvenile justice system. A bidders’ conference will be held
label: BODY

text: on Thursday, June 22 from 1:00-4:00 pm at the Crowne Plaza in Worcester, Massachusetts.
label: BODY

text: For more information: http://www.mass.gov/eopsfunding.htm click on Justice and Education
label: BODY

text: Other Funding Opportunities
label: HH1

text: Field-Initiated Research and Evaluation Program
label: HH3

text: Application Deadline: June 19, 2006
label: HH3

text: “The Office of Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention is looking for applicants for the Field-
label: BODY

text: Initiated Research and Evaluation Program. The goal of the program is to foster original, rigorous,
label: BODY

text: scientific research and evaluation studies using traditional or innovative methods to inform the
label: BODY

text: disciplines of juvenile justice and delinquency prevention and child maltreatment prevention and
label: BODY

text: intervention.”
label: BODY

text: For more information: http://ojjdp.ncjrs.gov/grants/solicitations/2006fire.pdf
label: BODY

text: Social Science Research on the Role and Impact of Forensic Evidence on the Criminal Justice
label: HH2

text: Process
label: HH3

text: Application Deadline: June 20, 2006
label: HH3

text: “The National Institute of Justice is seeking proposals for social science research that evaluates the use
label: BODY

text: of forensic evidence in the criminal justice system through the collection, analysis, and subsequent
label: BODY

text: investigative and adjudicative processes. Findings from this study could influence policies on such
label: BODY

text: issues as the allocation of resources and the training of laboratory and crime scene personnel.”
label: BODY

text: For more information: http://www.ncjrs.gov/pdffiles1/nij/SL000748.pdf
label: BODY

text: Research and Publications
label: HH1

text: Characteristics of Drivers Stopped by Police
label: HH3

text: The Bureau of Justice Statistics recently released this report detailing the nature and characteristics of
label: BODY

text: traffic stops, as collected by the 2002 Police Public Contact Survey, a supplement to the National
label: BODY

text: Crime Victimization Survey. Demographic information is presented on the 16.8 million drivers
label: BODY

text: stopped by police in 2002, as well as information on the various outcomes of traffic stops, including:
label: BODY

text: searches conducted by police, tickets issued to drivers stopped for speeding, arrests of stopped drivers,
label: BODY

text: and police use of force during a traffic stop.
label: BODY

text: Access full text at: http://www.ojp.usdoj.gov/bjs/abstract/cdsp02.htm
label: BODY

text: Synthetic Drug Control Strategy: A Focus on Methamphetamine and Prescription Drug Abuse
label: HH3

text: The Office of National Drug Control Policy presents the Administration's strategy for responding to
label: BODY

text: the illicit use and production of methamphetamine, and the illicit use of controlled substance
label: BODY

text: prescription drugs. The publication includes a progress report and a detailed description of current
label: BODY

text: goals to reduce production and use.
label: BODY

text: Access full text at: http://www.whitehousedrugpolicy.gov/publications/synthetic_drg_control_
label: BODY

text: strat/index.html
label: BODY

text: Prison and Jail Inmates at Midyear 2005
label: HH3

text: The Bureau of Justice Statistics is presenting data on prison and jail inmates, collected from National
label: BODY

text: Prisoner Statistics counts and the Census of Jail Inmates 2005. This midyear report contains statistics
label: BODY

text: on the number of prison inmates held in private facilities and the number of prisoners under 18 years of
label: BODY

text: age held by State correctional authorities. Numbers of prison and jail inmates by gender, race, and
label: BODY

text: Hispanic origin as well as counts of jail inmates by conviction status and confinement status are also
label: BODY

text: included.
label: BODY

text: Access full text at: http://www.ojp.usdoj.gov/bjs/abstract/pjim05.htm
label: BODY

text: Highlights of the 2004 National Youth Gang Survey
label: HH3

text: This recently released Office of Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention report provides an
label: BODY

text: overview of findings from the 2004 National Youth Gang Survey, the tenth annual survey conducted
label: BODY

text: by the National Youth Gang Center. Data is provided to shed light on youth gang activity in the United
label: BODY

text: States and includes the number of gangs, gang members, and gang-related homicides in larger cities,
label: BODY

text: suburban counties, smaller cities, and rural counties.
label: BODY

text: Access full text at: http://www.ojjdp.ncjrs.org/publications/PubAbstract.asp?pubi=235570
label: BODY

text: Local Police Departments and Sherriff’s Offices, 2003
label: HH2

text: The Bureau of Justice Statistics recently released two reports using data collected from the 2003 Law
label: BODY

text: Enforcement Management and Administrative Statistics (LEMAS) survey. Data is collected from a
label: BODY

text: representative sample of local police departments and sheriff’s offices nationwide and detail a variety
label: BODY

text: of agency characteristic. The sheriff’s office report includes national estimates for sheriffs' offices on
label: BODY

text: staff and financial resources, technologies and equipment in use, and agency policies and practices
label: BODY

text: covering a wide variety of law enforcement and administrative concerns. The law enforcement report
label: BODY

text: also includes national estimates for local police departments on issues including staff and financial
label: BODY

text: resources, technologies and equipment in use, and policies and practices of the agencies.
label: BODY

text: Access full text at: http://www.ojp.usdoj.gov/bjs/whtsnw2.htm
label: BODY

text: Conferences and Trainings
label: HH1

text: G.R.E.A.T. Officer Training: Gang Resistance Education and Training
label: HH3

text: The Executive Office of Public Safety is currently soliciting interest in G.R.E.A.T. (Gang Resistance
label: BODY

text: Education and Training) Officer Training. If enough officers are interested, the training will take place
label: BODY

text: during the last two weeks of August, 2006. Either 1-week or 2-week training will be offered to
label: BODY

text: certified/sworn, uniformed law enforcement officers with a minimum of one year of experience and
label: BODY

text: who agree to teach the G.R.E.A.T. curriculum in uniform.
label: BODY

text: For more information: http://www.mass.gov/eops click in key initiative module
label: BODY

text: Terrorism Symposium
label: HH3

text: June 12-13, 2006 in Denver, CO
label: HH3

text: The National Institute of Justice is hosting this event for law enforcement officials who deal with
label: BODY

text: terrorism in their states, cities, and communities. Panelists will share research findings and state and
label: BODY

text: local officials will be invited to describe their challenges and experiences in interactive sessions.
label: BODY

text: Topics will include: how to identify warning signs, what local prosecutors are doing to combat
label: BODY

text: terrorism, ways to improve cooperation between law enforcement and Arab communities, securing
label: BODY

text: shopping malls and seaports, and money laundering.
label: BODY

text: For more information: http://www.ojp.usdoj.gov/nij/events/register_ts.html
label: BODY

text: DNA Grantees Workshop
label: HH3

text: June 26-28, 2006 in Arlington, VA
label: HH3

text: The National Institute of Justice is announcing this DNA grantee workshop as a forum for discussion
label: BODY

text: on the current and future needs of public crime laboratories and how new technological innovations
label: BODY

text: can help meet those needs. The workshop will also give researchers the opportunity to provide project
label: BODY

text: updates, practitioners to discuss casework issues and concerns, and for researchers and practitioners to
label: BODY

text: work in partnership.
label: BODY

text: For more information: http://www.ojp.usdoj.gov/nij/events/welcome.html
label: BODY

text: Managing Juvenile Services
label: HH2

text: Various dates and locations listed below
label: HH3

text: The Office of Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention (OJJDP) is sponsoring the following
label: BODY

text: training sessions on managing juvenile services:
label: BODY

text: • Hartford, CT, June 26-30, 2006
label: BODY

text: • Spokane, WA, August 7-11, 2006
label: BODY

text: • Kansas City, MO, September 18-22, 2006
label: BODY

text: • Rochester, NY, October 23-27, 2006
label: BODY

text: This program will present management concepts to build leadership capacity and organizational
label: BODY

text: competency in the planning and delivery of juvenile services. Tuition, student materials, instructional
label: BODY

text: costs, and single-occupancy lodging will be provided by OJJDP. The participant is responsible for
label: BODY

text: transportation, meals, and incidental expenses.
label: BODY

text: For more information: http://dept.fvtc.edu/ojjdp/descriptions.htm#mjs
label: BODY

text: Criminal Intelligence Systems Training
label: HH3

text: July 13, 2006 in Franklin, MA
label: HH3

text: The Bureau of Justice Assistance (BJA) is offering a training, co-hosted by NESPIN, on the guidelines
label: BODY

text: governing the operation of federally funded criminal intelligence systems. The training includes
label: BODY

text: information on the following topics: training overview and resources, 28 Code of Federal Regulations
label: BODY

text: Part 23, complying with the regulation, storing criminal intelligence, inquiry and dissemination, and
label: BODY

text: review and purge. There is no registration fee but the class size is limited.
label: BODY

text: For more information: http://www.iir.com/28cfr/Franklin.htm
label: BODY

text: The 2006 NIJ Conference
label: HH3

text: July 17-19, 2006 in Washington, DC
label: HH3

text: The National Institute of Justice Conference (formally called the Research and Evaluation Conference)
label: BODY

text: spotlights what works, what doesn't work, and what the research shows as promising. Developments in
label: BODY

text: technology that increases public safety will be featured. Researchers interested in criminal justice,
label: BODY

text: policymakers responsible for shaping public safety or social services, practitioners in criminal justice
label: BODY

text: and students interested in criminal justice issues are invited to attend.
label: BODY

text: For more information: http://www.ojp.usdoj.gov/nij/events/nij_conference2006.html
label: BODY

text: 2006 National Community Policing Conference - Community Policing: Leading the Way to a
label: HH2

text: Safer Nation
label: HH3

text: July 27-29, 2006 in Washington, DC
label: HH3

text: This Office of Community Oriented Policing Services (COPS) conference will feature more than
label: BODY

text: 48 workshops grouped into seven subject tracks offering leadership strategies: Leading in Change,
label: BODY

text: Leading in Innovation, Leading in Crisis, Leading in Integrity, Leading in Science and Technology,
label: BODY

text: Ahead of the Curve, and Contemporary Issues in Community Policing. Command and patrol-level
label: BODY

text: law enforcement personnel, state and local government executives, criminal justice professionals,
label: BODY

text: educators, community leaders, and others interested in the implementation and future direction of
label: BODY

text: community policing are invited to attend.
label: BODY

text: For more information: http://www.cops.usdoj.gov/Default.asp?Item=1044
label: BODY

text: In The News
label: HH1

text: Boston's New Problem: Stop Emerging Girl Gang "Epidemic"
label: HH3

text: Boston Herald, May 12, 2006
label: HH3

text: According to the Boston Herald, Boston Mayor Thomas Menino is ordering new steps to stop the
label: BODY

text: violence between gangs of young girls, including the addition of female police detectives to a special
label: BODY

text: unit. The rise in violent crimes committed by teenage girls who associate or travel in loosely organized
label: BODY

text: groups prompted Commissioner Kathleen O’Toole to ask for more female cops in the Youth Violence
label: BODY

text: Strike Force. Teen girls were involved in at least four incidents of armed violence during the second
label: BODY

text: week of May.
label: BODY

text: Access full text at: http://news.bostonherald.com/localRegional/view.bg?articleid=138947
label: BODY

text: Boston Plans 24/7 Surveillance Of Hard-Core Criminals
label: HH3

text: Boston Globe, May 16, 2006
label: HH3

text: According to a recent Boston Globe article, Boston police will increase twenty-four hour surveillance
label: BODY

text: of dozens of hard-core criminals on the city's streets to help curb violence in what is feared to be a
label: BODY

text: particularly bloody summer. The new tracking program, referred inside the department as ''A Day in
label: BODY

text: the Life," calls for monitoring the criminals who are believed to be largely responsible for the shocking
label: BODY

text: increase in gun violence.
label: BODY

text: Access full text at: http://www.boston.com/news/local/massachusetts/articles/2006/05/16/police_
label: BODY

text: planning_tight_surveillance_of_worst_criminals/
label: BODY

text: Boston Officials Launch Gun Buyback Program
label: HH3

text: Boston Globe, May 30, 2006
label: HH3

text: The Boston Globe indicated that City and police officials, and community leaders have recently
label: BODY

text: announced that a gun buyback program is restarting in Boston. About $40,000 has been raised for the
label: BODY

text: program, which details that people who turn in guns will be given $200 in Target gift cards. Gift cards
label: BODY

text: will be used instead of cash because criminologists have found that in previous buyback programs,
label: BODY

text: certain individuals used the buyback money to purchase newer guns.
label: BODY

text: Access full text at: http://www.boston.com/news/globe/city_region/breaking_news/2006/05/
label: BODY

text: boston_official.html
label: BODY

text: Boston Tests Electronic Crime Alert System For Public
label: HH3

text: Boston Globe, June 2, 2006
label: HH3

text: Boston is starting a crime alert system that will notify residents when crimes occur in their
label: BODY

text: neighborhoods, reports the Boston Globe. The system will disseminate crucial information about
label: BODY

text: crimes through text messages, e-mails, and faxes to Boston residents. The program will initially be
label: BODY

text: tested in three police districts, Dorchester, South Boston, and Roxbury, and could expand to cover the
label: BODY

text: rest of the city later this year.
label: BODY

text: Access full text at: http://www.boston.com/news/local/massachusetts/articles/2006/06/02/city_police_
label: BODY

text: to_send_residents_electronic_crime_alerts/
label: BODY
